body:
subj. I would say for starters, one-to-many (one package many tags) without hierarchies of tags is perfectly enough to help users better orient in packages.

As a CLI i think it's enough to have:

```
spack tags                   (show all tags with their short description, two column print out)
spack list --tag=<var>       (show all packages from a tag <var>)
spack find --tag=<var>       (show all installed packages from a tag <var>)
```

Each package declare tags via:

```
tags = one, two, three
```

with some (manual) checks that `one, two, three` are contained in the list of tags stored in `repo.yaml` as a pairs of strings `name - description`.

in reference to the discussion  https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/spack/zGs-0RKz3_U
title: add tags to packages
